db:abstract.db:para: This type was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:listitem.db:para: DialStyle is part of Styling Controls

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: You can create a custom dial by replacing the following delegates:

db:section.db:title: background : Component
db:section.db:para: The background of the dial.
The implicit size of the dial is taken from this component.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] control : Dial
db:section.db:para: The Dial that this style is attached to.

db:section.db:title: handle : Component
db:section.db:para: The handle of the dial.
The handle is automatically positioned within the dial, based on the handleInset and the implicit width and height of the handle itself.

db:section.db:title: handleInset : real
db:section.db:para: The distance in pixels from the outside of the dial (outerRadius) to the center of the handle.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] labelCount : int
db:section.db:para: The amount of tickmark labels displayed by the dial, calculated from labelStepSize and the control's minimumValue and maximumValue.

db:section.db:title: labelInset : real
db:section.db:para: The distance in pixels from the outside of the dial (outerRadius) at which the center of the value marker text is drawn.

db:section.db:title: labelStepSize : real
db:section.db:para: The interval at which tickmark labels are displayed.

For example, if this property is set to 10 (the default), control.minimumValue to 0, and control.maximumValue to 100, the tickmark labels displayed will be 0, 10, 20, etc., to 100, along the circumference of the dial.

db:section.db:title: minorTickmark : Component
db:section.db:para: This component defines each individual minor tickmark. The position of each minor tickmark is already set; only the implicitWidth and implicitHeight need to be specified.
Each instance of this component has access to the following properties:

db:td.db:para: The value that this tickmark represents.

db:section.db:para: By default, no minor tickmark is defined.

db:section.db:title: minorTickmarkCount : int
db:section.db:para: The amount of minor tickmarks between each tickmark.

db:section.db:title: minorTickmarkInset : real
db:section.db:para: The distance in pixels from the outside of the dial (outerRadius) at which the outermost point of the minor tickmark line is drawn.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] outerRadius : real
db:section.db:para: The distance from the center of the dial to the outer edge of the dial.
This property is useful for determining the size of the various components of the style, in order to ensure that they are scaled proportionately when the dial is resized.

db:section.db:title: padding group
db:section.db:para: This grouped property holds the top, left, right and bottom padding.

db:section.db:title: tickmark : Component
db:section.db:para: This component defines each individual tickmark. The position of each tickmark is already set; only the implicitWidth and implicitHeight need to be specified.
Each instance of this component has access to the following properties:

db:td.db:para: The value that this tickmark represents.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] tickmarkCount : int
db:section.db:para: The amount of tickmarks displayed by the dial, calculated from tickmarkStepSize and the control's minimumValue and maximumValue.

db:section.db:title: tickmarkInset : real
db:section.db:para: The distance in pixels from the outside of the dial (outerRadius) at which the outermost point of the tickmark line is drawn.

db:section.db:title: tickmarkLabel : Component
db:section.db:para: This defines the text of each tickmark label on the dial.
Each instance of this component has access to the following properties:

db:td.db:para: The value that this label represents.

db:section.db:para: By default, no label is defined.

db:section.db:title: tickmarkStepSize : real
db:section.db:para: The interval at which tickmarks are displayed.
For example, if this property is set to 10, control.minimumValue to 0, and control.maximumValue to 100, the tickmarks displayed will be 0, 10, 20, etc., to 100, along the circumference of the dial.

db:section.db:title: real valueToAngle(real value)
db:section.db:para: Returns value as an angle in degrees.

This function is useful for custom drawing or positioning of items in the style's components. For example, it can be used to calculate the angles at which to draw an arc around the dial indicating the safe range of values.
